12:06 <MasterPiece``> has quit  
12:42 <gdelhumeau> i've built the last snapshot and it does not run  
12:42 <gdelhumeau> problem with LESS apparently  
12:46 <gdelhumeau> http://hastebin.com/lociwegoze.avrasm  
12:46 <gdelhumeau> Caused by: org.infinispan.commons.CacheException: Unable to invoke method public void org.infinispan.persistence.manager.PersistenceManagerImpl.start() on object of type PersistenceManagerImpl  
13:02 <tmortagne> java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space  
13:02 <tmortagne> ( gdelhumeau )  
13:02 <tmortagne> that seems to be the real issue in your case  
13:03 <gdelhumeau> yes but why  
13:03 <tmortagne> looks like something is taking more memory than it used to I guess  
13:03 <gdelhumeau> I'm using 56% of my memory  
13:04 <tmortagne> that does not reallt matter  
13:04 <tmortagne> it's not saying you don't have memory in your computer, it's saying java does not have enough allocated memory  
13:05 <tmortagne> so something is eating a lot of Java memory, best in that case is to take a memory dump and look at it with something like yourkit  
13:05 <tmortagne> you should find quickly what is taking so much heap  
13:10 <gdelhumeau> BTW the intellij license exprires tomorow: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DevelopmentToolLicenses#HIntelliJIDEAOpenSourceLicenseforXWiki  
13:29 <MasterPiece> has joined #xwiki  
14:05 <gsmeria> has quit  
14:11 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: going to ask for a renewal  
14:11 <vmassol> in the meantile you can use the community edition or the EAP versions  
14:11 <vmassol> \*meantime
